newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakh result of tender for national grid in doubt.
newsitem.headline: Kazakh result of tender for national grid in doubt.

text.p: Britain's National Grid Group's right to negotiate terms to operate Kazakhstan's power transmission system was in doubt on Monday when a Kazakh official said there was still no final decision on the tender.

Last month, National Grid announced it had secured exclusive negotiating rights for a 25-year contract to manage the former Soviet republic's 16,000 km (10,000 mile) high voltage grid, putting Sweden's ABB AB out of the running.
"There is no final decision (on the tender)," said a senior Kazakh privatisation official close to the deal who declined to be named.
Details of the contract are a closely guarded secret but last month a Kazakh official said the tender had been delayed while the government waited for both companies to improve their offers.

Tenders in the resource-rich Central Asian state are often delayed over last minute haggling. The Kazakh government has said the national grid is a strategic resource and would therefore not be privatised.
